hero.headline: Code. Logic. Domination.
hero.subheadline: Architecting systems while silently judging your spaghetti.

about.story: Marco Valenti is a Tech Lead who builds scalable software architectures and debugs production nightmares. A veteran backend developer and open-source contributor, he wields Python and React with surgical precision. He tolerates meetings, but only as a necessary evil.

projects.title: Microservices Migration
projects.description: Resurrected a monolithic e-commerce platform, handling 1M users, by surgically extracting microservices. The screams of the legacy code still echo.

projects.title: Data Validation Library
projects.description: A lean, mean data validation library that's been downloaded 50,000 times. It's probably preventing some serious data corruption out there.

steps.title: Define the Suffering
steps.description: Write the tests *first*. Let them dictate the code's miserable existence.

steps.title: Code to Atone
steps.description: Write the code to pass the tests. No more, no less. Efficiency is paramount.

steps.title: Review the Heresy
steps.description: Rigorous code review. Crush any deviation from the established dogma.

stories.failure: Accidentally dropped the production database on a Friday afternoon.
stories.lesson: Backups are not optional. Permissions are your only friends. Redundancy is the only path to salvation. And *never* deploy on a Friday.
